I am Getting error through posting.




I configure CSRF

also the URL Prefix

entry.title: Error Importing SAP Ariba Event Management API into SAP Build – "API Specification File is Invalid"
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’m currently working on creating an Action Project in SAP Build Process Automation using the Event Management API from SAP Ariba, which I accessed via the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

Here’s the navigation path I followed:
SAP Business Accelerator Hub > SAP Ariba > SAP Ariba APIs > Event Management API


I received the following error message:

"The API specification file is invalid. As the uploaded file specification format does not align with OpenAPI or CSDL specification standards."

It appears that the specification file provided might not be in OpenAPI (Swagger) or CSDL (OData) format, which is required by SAP Build.

Has anyone successfully integrated the Ariba Event Management API with SAP Build Process Automation?

Any insights, experiences, or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance!

Best regards,

entry.title: Blog Post : Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation on a Trial Account
entry.content:
Introduction

In today's digital world, automating document-heavy processes is key to improving efficiency and accuracy. Manually extracting data from invoices, purchase orders, or delivery notes is time-consuming and prone to errors. This is where the powerful combination of SAP Document AI and SAP Build Process Automation comes into play.

SAP Document AI uses machine learning to intelligently extract structured data from unstructured documents. SAP Build Process Automation allows you to design, build, and run automated workflows. By integrating these two services, you can create robust automations that read, interpret, and process documents just like a human would, but faster and without fatigue.

In this blog post, we will walk through the steps to integrate these two services on a trial account, using a standard invoice schema to extract data.

Prerequisites

  • An active SAP BTP Trial Account.
  • Access to SAP Build Process Automation in your trial subaccount.
  • Basic familiarity with the SAP Build Process Automation studio.

Step 1: Subscribe to SAP Document AI

The easiest way to get started with SAP Document AI on SAP BTP is by using the booster tool.

  1. Log in to your SAP BTP Trial Account cockpit.
  2. Navigate to your Subaccount and go to the Booster.
  3. Search for "SAP Document AI" and click on Start.
  4. Run the booster. It will automatically:
    1. Subscribe you to the service.
    2. Create a service instance and a service key.
  5. Once the booster completes, go to your Subaccount -> Instances and Subscriptions.
  6. Find your newly created service instance for SAP Document AI and navigate to its Service Keys. Open the default service key.
  7. Crucial: From the JSON of the service key, note down the following values. You will need them in the next step:
    1. uaa.clientid
    2. uaa.clientsecret
    3. uaa.url
Note: To access the SAP Document AI service on the browser (e.g., to check schemas or test manually), ensure your user has the appropriate roles assigned by the booster, such as Document_Information_Extraction_Viewer.

Step 2: Generate an Access Token in your Automation

To call any SAP Document AI API, you need a valid OAuth access token. We will generate this using the client credentials from the service key.

  1. In your SAP Build Process Automation project, create three String variables:
    1. uaaUrl (Value: The uaa.url from your service key)
    2. clientId (Value: The uaa.clientid from your service key)
    3. clientSecret (Value: The uaa.clientsecret from your service key)
  2. Create a fourth variable to hold the combined client ID and secret, encoded in Base64. Name it clientInfo.
  3. Use a Script activity to construct the request for the access token. Set the Output parameter of this script to a variable of type Any (e.g., optionsGet).
    1. Script Code for Access Token Request:
return {
    method: 'GET',
    url: uaaUrl + '/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials',
    responseType: 'json', 
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    headers:{
        Authorization:'Basic ' + clientInfo
    }
};
  • After this script, use an Rest Call Web Service activity.
  • The response contains an access_token field. Extract this token into a new string variable or directly pass it to the variable. The value should be:
    1. "Bearer " + step2.obj.access_token

Step 3: Upload a Document for Processing

Now that we have an access token, we can upload an invoice document for processing. We will use the pre-built SAP_invoice_schema.

  1. Ensure you have the path to your invoice file stored in a variable (e.g., fileObj).
  2. Use another Script activity to construct the multipart/form-data request for document upload. The output will be your request configuration.
  3. Use an Rest Call Web Service activity to execute this request.
    1. Script Code for Document Upload:
// Define the extraction options
let optionsPayload = {
    documentType: "custom",
    schemaName: "SAP_invoice_schema", // Using the pre-built schema
    // Below commented values are optional, if you want you can use as per requirement.
    //headerFields: ["deliveryNoteNumber", "purchaseOrderNumber", "deliveryDate"],
    //lineItemFields: ["materialNumber", "quantity", "unitOfMeasure"],
    clientId: "default"
};

// Construct the HTTP request options
let requestOptions = {
    method: "POST",
    url: "https://aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs",
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    metadataType: irpa_core.enums.request.metadataType.formData, // Crucial for file upload
    headers: {
        Authorization: access_Token // Use the variable from previous step
    },
    metadata: [
        {
            name: "file",
            file: fileObj, // Variable holding the file path
        },
        {
            name: "options",
            value: JSON.stringify(optionsPayload)
        }
    ],
    timeout: 30000 // Set a longer timeout for file upload
};

return requestOptions;​
  • From the uploadResponse, extract two crucial values:
    1. The job id (e.g., into jobId). You will need this to check the result.
    2. The initial status. It will be 'PENDING', meaning the AI is processing the document.

Step 4: Retrieve the Extracted Data

Processing with AI is not instantaneous. We need to poll the service until the status changes from PENDING to DONE.

  1. Create a Data Type: First, create a simple Data Type (e.g., ExtractionResult) with two fields:
    1. Status (Type: String)
    2. Data (Type: Any)
  2. Create a Variable: Create a variable (e.g., finalResult) of this custom type ExtractionResult.
  3. Set Initial Value: Initialize this variable. Set Status to 'PENDING' and leave Data blank.
  4. Build the Polling Request: Create a Script activity to build a GET request to check the job status. The output will be used in an HTTP Request.
    1. Script Code for Retrieving Job Status/Result:
let requestOptions = {
    method: "GET",
    // Use the jobId from the upload step in the URL
    url: "https://aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs/" + jobId,
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    headers: {
        Authorization: access_Token, // Re-use the same access token
        'Cache-Control': 'no-cache'
    }
};
return requestOptions;​
  • Implement the Polling Loop:
    1. Drag a Forever Loop into your workflow.
    2. In the loop's Condition, use the expression: finalResult.Status !== 'PENDING'. This means the loop will break as soon as the status is no longer 'PENDING'.
    3. Inside the loop:
      1. Use a Wait activity (e.g., wait for 2 seconds) to avoid making too many API calls.
      2. Use the Rest Call Web Service activity with the configuration from the script above. Store the output in a temporary variable (e.g., pollResponse).
      3. Use a Set Variable activity to update finalResult.Status with pollResponse.status  with pollResponse.
    4. The loop will continue until the status in the API response changes to 'DONE'. Once it breaks out of the loop, finalResult.Data will contain the fully extracted invoice data!

You can now use the extracted data in the subsequent steps of your automation, such as filling a form or triggering another process.

The Flow will look like this:

Conclusion

Congratulations! You have successfully integrated SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation. You have built an automation that can submit documents for processing and patiently wait for the AI to return the extracted structured data. This pattern can be applied to countless use cases involving invoices, contracts, forms, and more, unlocking significant potential for automation within your business processes.

This is just the beginning. You can explore creating custom schemas tailored to your specific document types for even more precise extraction.

Feel free to connect here or on LinkedIn for any questions or suggestions.

LinkedIn : Indrajit Shah https://www.linkedin.com/in/indrajit-shahkumar/
LinkedIn : Aditi Jain https://www.linkedin.com/in/aditi-jain-3b6b4a190/
Co-Author @Aditii_Jain

entry.title: How to connect to HANA DB through SAP BPA?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Is there a way we can connect to HANA DB through SAP BPA directly? Or if there are any other intermediate ways through actions to make this happen?

Thanks,

Karthika Vijayan

entry.title: Mail Content Translation in SAP BPA
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a SAP Build Process Automation process with a Send Mail task. With regards to the subject and contents of the e-mail body, where and how do you need to maintain the translations in different languages ?

The Mail editor doesn't seem to have any options for translations.

Regards,

Melwyn

entry.title: How to Trigger Reminder Emails for Approvers/Finance Reviewer if No Action After N+2 Days in SAP
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I’m working on a workflow scenario in SAP Build Process Automation where purchase orders go through multiple approval levels (e.g., Approvers and Finance Reviewer).

The requirement is:

  • If an approver or finance reviewer does not take any action within N+2 days (2 days after task creation/assignment), the system should automatically trigger a reminder email.

  • Ideally, this should continue until action is taken, or the task is escalated.

entry.title: How to upload the attachments that are stored in BTP DMS to sharepoint or onedrive using BPA
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I would like to upload the file that are stored in DMS to Microsoft 365 sharepoint or onedrive.

Our current plan is 

1. User will upload the attachment files from Build Process Automation approval form.

2. The attachment files will be stored in Document Management Service, Integration Option.

3. Since all of the history records are removed from "My Inbox" when approver approved/rejected the approval request form,

we would like to keep the attachments and approval request form data in Microsoft sharepoint or onedrive.

 

So, How can we upload the files of DMS to Microsoft sharepoint or onedrive.

I did not find any related documents/blogs regarding to No.3.

So, if you have any documents/blogs or any information about this, could you please share with me?

 

Best regards,

Aye Chan

entry.title: Build proces Automation:Assign result to output parameter in Custom script
entry.content:
I have custom script task to read the input from email body contains some key values, each value in newline like " ID : 123

Name : XYZ etc"

I am using the regular expression to match the value and extract it, when I run the same code it is running fine in online script running console.

here i am clueless reagding how to assign the result to output parameter and read the values in another flow task.

entry.title: Mutliple BPA workflows within iRPA automation
entry.content:
So most of the examples I see with regards to executing automation and workflows are in regards to 1 process, as an example executing a workflow for one invoice.

I am attempting to scan a folder that may contain multiple invoices and hence kick off separate workflows for each one. The automation has an option to include a "Process" which I thought would be my workflow process. However the "Process" needs a trigger defined but in this case I was hoping for the automation to simply execute it. Looks like this is not possible? How can my project execute multiple workflows for each run?

Thank you!

entry.title: Queuing of SAP GUI background processes after BPA bot closes session
entry.content:
When the SAP GUI recorder finishes processing by the BPA bot, I notice that multiple SAP GUI icons remain queued in the system tray. Once I hover the mouse over them, they disappear automatically.
My concern is whether these “ghost” sessions could cause problems on the machine.
Is there a way to ensure that SAP GUI sessions are completely terminated after the bot closes the connection?

Environment:
SAP Build Process Automation (BTP)
Desktop Agent (version …)
SAP GUI 7.8 / Logon 800

entry.title: How to handle unexpected pop-up windows in SAP GUI recording with SAP Build Process Automation?
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am currently working with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA) and I have a recording in SAP GUI that executes a bot.
The issue is that sometimes, when starting the SAP session, an unexpected pop-up window appears (for example due to updates, maintenance, or security certificates). These windows do not always show up, and when they do, they break the bot execution because they are not part of the recording.

What is the best practice to handle such occasional pop-up windows in an SAP GUI recording?
Is there a recommended way to manage them without having to record every possible case manually?

Thank you for your support!

entry.title: SAP Desktop Agent starts and disappears during automation
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m facing an issue with SAP Intelligent RPA Desktop Agent (v3.32.58, Unattended mode). When I run my automation, the agent starts but immediately disappears without executing, and status goes back to Idle – Connected to tenant, waiting for a project to be loaded.

Any guidance on fixing this (reinstall, deployment settings, or log checks) would be appreciated.

Thanks!

entry.title: Subscription to SAP Build process automation is consistantly failing in BTP trial account
entry.content:
Hi, 

The subscription is taking longer times and finally having failed status in the BTP trial account.

entry.title: Passing a LIST between Automations
entry.content:
(re-posting here because not getting much traction under "Tooling (+ SAP Build) Forum").

I've been trying to pass data out (output) of an Automation, into another one, and I'm not able to.  My Output Parameter was always blank.  I had to merge my logic into a single Automation to achieve my solution.

Sample Process:

Parameters of getData Automation:

I found some info that the best way to read from a local Excel file is to use the Excel Cloud Link activity, which is recommended to use a "any" type variable.  This type of variable does not seem to support LISTS either.  I then learned that the TRY statement creates an isolated local "visibility" layer, so I created my "global" variable outside this TRY later.  I tried different ways to pass the Excel data to my global variable (both work) but I cannot pass the data to my Automation Output Parameter.

Can someone please confirm that LISTS of type ANY/Custom are not supported as Parameters of Automations?

Thank you.

entry.title: SAP GUI Automation within SAP BPA Workflow Process
entry.content:
Hello everyone, 

I am building a process in SAP Build Process Automation where:

  • A user manually fills an input form and clicks Submit. Based on the input dropdown/select values and other conditions, the workflow should trigger automation that perform a sequence of steps inside SAP GUI (open transaction, input fields, save).

What I want to know/Problems i am trying to solve:

  1. Can I include SAP GUI recording-based automation inside a BPA workflow? 
  2. Should I design this as attended or Unattended? Which is best fit when the workflow must continue after form submission without user interaction?
  3. Any best practices for login, error handling, and scaling such automations?
  4. Would it be better to use APIs instead of GUI automation when possible?

Any ample patterns (form --> workflow --> automation --> email) would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Build process automation : Error adding MDG approval and visualization from trial account
entry.content: I have a BTP trial account. Have default identity provider and custom identity provider set up with necessary roles. Subscribed to SAP build process automation and succesful in launching it. But trying to add Master Data process approval and visualization, leads to error with text  'An error occured. Please create an incident with component CA-AP.'

entry.title: iRPA job keeps on failing
entry.content:
Good day,

I am having a problem with one of scheduled jobs in our system. It always fails, for no reason. I checked the result of the job, and it just says "Job has failed: KO". I have checked the trace and it doesn't have any helpful error except just saying irpa.core.KO and no details.

Here is what the trace says:

I have no idea why this is happening or what is causing it. Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you very much!

entry.title: Cant reuse variable within same automation in SAP BPA
entry.content:
Hi all, we are using automation scenario where certain variant is selected in sap gui (row 0 for example) and result of this is sent to defined users. Both variant row and email recipients are later defined in environment variables. In IRPA (predecessor of BPA) these variables were always defined when creating scenario trigger, so it was possible to define them for each new trigger. Now in BPA this seems to be not working as variables need to be defined when deploying the scenario. 

I wonder if this functionality is gone or is there any other approach how to leverage same scenario and run it with another variables? So far this seems to be like step beck as I would have to clone the same scenario and deploy it only because of another variables.

Many thanks for your answer.
